code: @Manual{,   title = {ndsbr: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study},   author = {Pedro Augusto {Borges dos Santos}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.1},   url = {https://pabsantos.github.io/ndsbr/}, }

what: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study
title: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study
text: goal ndsbr help load, manipulate analyze data sample Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study (NDS-BR).

title: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study
text: package privides two main categories functions: nds_create nds_calc, addition utility functions. nds_create functions used create spatial objects sf format, using naturalistic data input: nds_create_points nds_create_lines nds_calc functions can used extract basic information naturalistic sample (traveled time traveled distance) safety-related variables, speeding: nds_calc_dist nds_calc_time nds_calc_speeding nds_load_data used load naturalistic data nds_download_sf can used download spatial data import project environment. brief presentation (portuguese) ndsbr can accessed .

title: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study
text: can install current version ndsbr like :

title: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study
text: basic example shows load NDS-BR data calculate traveled distances. First, nds_load_data loads sample NDS-BR files inside specific folder, defined user. Creating sf object linestring geometry using nds_create_lines  Finally, nds_calc_dist extracts traveled distance, grouped variable defined user.
code: library(ndsbr) path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") ## Example files location nds_data <- nds_load_data("driver", path)  head(nds_data, n = 5) #> # A tibble: 5 × 34 #>   DRIVER  LONG   LAT DAY       DAY_CORRIGIDO `03:00:00`  TRIP ID    PR         H #>   <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <chr>         <chr>      <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:27       5 A05   19:17…    NA #> 2 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:28       5 A05   19:17…     0 #> 3 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:29       5 A05   19:17…     0 #> 4 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:30       5 A05   19:17…     0 #> 5 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:31       5 A05   19:17…     0 #> # ℹ 24 more variables: M <dbl>, S <dbl>, TIME_ACUM <dbl>, SPD_MPH <dbl>, #> #   SPD_KMH <dbl>, ACEL_MS2 <dbl>, HEADING <dbl>, ALTITUDE_FT <dbl>, #> #   VALID_TIME <chr>, TIMESTAMP_GPS <chr>, CPOOL <chr>, CPOOLING_CHECKED <chr>, #> #   WSB <chr>, UMP_YN <chr>, UMP <chr>, PICK_UP <chr>, ACTION <chr>, #> #   GPS_FILE <chr>, CIDADE <chr>, BAIRRO <chr>, NOME_RUA <chr>, #> #   HIERARQUIA_CWB <chr>, HIERARQUIA_CTB <chr>, LIMITE_VEL <chr> nds_lines <- nds_create_lines(nds_data, x = LONG, y = LAT)  plot(nds_lines["DRIVER"]) nds_dist <- nds_calc_dist(nds_lines, geom = wkt_lines, by = DRIVER) nds_dist #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   DRIVER   DIST #>   <chr>   <dbl> #> 1 A      22508. #> 2 B      51529. #> 3 C      37736.

what: Neighborhood Boundaries Data for Curitiba — ippuc_neigh
title: Neighborhood Boundaries Data for Curitiba — ippuc_neigh
text: dataset containing neighborhood boundaries Curitiba, Brazil.

title: Neighborhood Boundaries Data for Curitiba — ippuc_neigh
Neighborhood Boundaries Data for Curitiba — ippuc_neigh
text: data frame sf object 75 observations 10 variables: OBJECTID num. unique identifier neighborhood boundary object. CODIGO num. code representing neighborhood. TIPO chr. type boundary, "DIVISA DE BAIRROS". NOME chr. name neighborhood. FONTE chr. source boundary information, usually municipal decree. CD_REGIONA num. code representing region neighborhood belongs. NM_REGIONA chr. name region neighborhood belongs. SHAPE_AREA num. area neighborhood square meters. SHAPE_LEN num. perimeter length neighborhood meters. geometry sfc_POLYGON. spatial geometry neighborhood boundary.

title: Neighborhood Boundaries Data for Curitiba — ippuc_neigh
text: Curitiba Municipal Government (IPPUC).

title: Road Data for Curitiba — ippuc_road_axis
text: dataset containing road information Curitiba, Brazil.

title: Road Data for Curitiba — ippuc_road_axis
Road Data for Curitiba — ippuc_road_axis
text: data frame sf object 40,355 observations 22 variables: CHAVE chr. unique key identifier road segment. CODVIA chr. code road. NOINICIO chr. starting number road segment. NOFIM chr. ending number road segment. STATUS chr. status road segment (e.g., "OFICIAL"). NMVIA chr. name road. NMVIA_ANT chr. former name road, . SVIARIO chr. classification road. SVIARIOLEG chr. legal reference road classification. HIERARQUIA chr. hierarchy level road. STATUS_DEM chr. official status road. COD_BAIRRO num. code neighborhood BAIRRO_E chr. name neighborhood left side road. BAIRRO_D chr. name neighborhood right side road. COD_REG num. code region. REGIONAL_E chr. name regional administration left side road. REGIONAL_D chr. name regional administration right side road. CEP_E chr. postal code left side road. CEP_D chr. postal code right side road. CEP_INFO chr. Information postal code. CEP_FONTE chr. source postal code information. geometry sfc_MULTILINESTRING. spatial geometry road segment.

title: Road Data for Curitiba — ippuc_road_axis
text: Provided municipal authorities Curitiba (IPPUC).

what: Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
title: Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
text: nds_calc_dist extracts traveled time naturalistic data.

title: Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
text: data sf object linestring geometry geom geometry column sf object column name group results units desired distance unit ("meters", "kilometers")

title: Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
text: tibble traveled distance results

title: Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
text: function uses sf object (nds_create_lines) main input extracts traveled distance, grouping results attributes desired variable (parameter ). distance unit can "meters" (default) "kilometers". geom parameter used identify column contains geometry sf object.

title: Calculate traveled distance from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_dist
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") nds_data <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. nds_lines <- nds_create_lines(nds_data, x = LONG, y = LAT) nds_calc_dist(nds_lines, wkt_lines, DRIVER) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   DRIVER   DIST #>   <chr>   <dbl> #> 1 A      22508. #> 2 B      51529. #> 3 C      37736.

what: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
title: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
text: nds_calc_speeding extracts speeding rate naturalistic data

title: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
code: nds_calc_speeding(data, type, by, spd, exp, percentage = FALSE)

title: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
text: data Object naturalistic data (tibble sf) type Character type speeding results ("time" "distance") column name group results spd Numeric value speeding threshold exp Numeric value exposure threshold percentage Boolean value establishing thresholds percentages (TRUE FALSE)

title: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
text: tibble speeding rate results

title: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
text: function uses naturalistic data main input extracts speeding rate , grouping results attributes desired variable (parameter ). type set "distance", data must sf object linestring geometry. Otherwise, can tibble data.frame. spd exp sets two thresholds identify exposure speeding situations, based performed speeds speed limits. percentage TRUE, thresholds set percentages speed limit.

title: Calculate speeding rate from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_speeding
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") nds_data <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. nds_calc_speeding(nds_data, type = "time", by = ID, spd = 5, exp = 10) #> # A tibble: 9 × 2 #> # Groups:   ID [9] #>   ID       SP #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 A05   0.302 #> 2 A12   0.303 #> 3 A18   0.075 #> 4 B08   0.105 #> 5 B13   0.422 #> 6 B18   0.379 #> 7 C04   0.273 #> 8 C07   0.418 #> 9 C13   0.505

text: nds_calc_time extracts traveled time naturalistic data.

title: Calculate traveled time from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_time
Calculate traveled time from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_time
text: data tibble data.frame object containing naturalistic data column name group results units desired time unit ("seconds", "minutes" "hours") valid Option select data valid data ("", "yes").

title: Calculate traveled time from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_time
text: tibble traveled time results.

title: Calculate traveled time from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_time
text: function uses naturalistic data sample (nds_load_data) main input extracts traveled time, grouping results attributes desired variable (parameter ). time unit can "seconds" (default), "minutes" "hours". possible filter valid time data using valid parameter. default, function uses data, including invalid times.

title: Calculate traveled time from the naturalistic data — nds_calc_time
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") df <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. nds_calc_time(df, "DRIVER") #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   `"DRIVER"`  TIME #>   <chr>      <int> #> 1 DRIVER     18014

what: Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
title: Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
text: function creates sf object using linestring geometry, based NDS-BR naturalistic data (see nds_load_data).

title: Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
text: data data.frame tibble object coordinates. x Data attribute x coordinates. y Data attribute y coordinates. valid Option select data valid data ("", "yes").

title: Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
text: sf object linestring geometry.

title: Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
text: nds_create_lines takes naturalistic data input creates linestring spatial object. x y arguments considers longitude latitude, respectively. possible filter valid time data using valid parameter, based VALID_TIME attribute. default, function transforms data, including invalid times.

title: Create a sf object using the linestring geometry — nds_create_lines
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") nds_data <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. nds_create_lines(nds_data, x = LONG, y = LAT) #> Simple feature collection with 17985 features and 34 fields #> Geometry type: LINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -49.33385 ymin: -25.5531 xmax: -49.18389 ymax: -25.37371 #> Geodetic CRS:  SIRGAS 2000 #> # A tibble: 17,985 × 35 #>    DRIVER  LONG   LAT DAY       DAY_CORRIGIDO `03:00:00`  TRIP ID    PR        H #>  * <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>     <chr>         <chr>      <dbl> <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:28       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  2 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:29       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  3 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:30       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  4 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:31       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  5 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:32       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  6 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:33       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  7 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:34       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  8 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:35       5 A05   19:1…     0 #>  9 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:36       5 A05   19:1…     0 #> 10 A      -49.2 -25.5 26/8/2019 26/8/2019     22:17:37       5 A05   19:1…     0 #> # ℹ 17,975 more rows #> # ℹ 25 more variables: M <dbl>, S <dbl>, TIME_ACUM <dbl>, SPD_MPH <dbl>, #> #   SPD_KMH <dbl>, ACEL_MS2 <dbl>, HEADING <dbl>, ALTITUDE_FT <dbl>, #> #   VALID_TIME <chr>, TIMESTAMP_GPS <chr>, CPOOL <chr>, CPOOLING_CHECKED <chr>, #> #   WSB <chr>, UMP_YN <chr>, UMP <chr>, PICK_UP <chr>, ACTION <chr>, #> #   GPS_FILE <chr>, CIDADE <chr>, BAIRRO <chr>, NOME_RUA <chr>, #> #   HIERARQUIA_CWB <chr>, HIERARQUIA_CTB <chr>, LIMITE_VEL <chr>, …

title: Create a sf object with point geometry — nds_create_points

title: Create a sf object with point geometry — nds_create_points
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") nds_data <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. what: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
title: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
text: function loads one .csv files containing NDS-BR data.

title: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
code: nds_load_data(pattern, folder = NULL, sep = ";", vars = NULL)

title: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
text: pattern character object common initial text among files read. folder character object path folder containing files. sep character object defining separator .csv file. Default ";". vars character vector variable names load. empty, variables loaded.

title: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
text: tibble NDS-BR dataset.

title: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
text: nds_load_data default considers data inside .csv files separated ';', decimals expressed comma (','). sep set ",", decimals must expressed ".". pattern argument used identify common initial text among files. one file loaded, pattern can full name file. folder argument possible insert path folder files included. field left empty, function considers files present working directory project (getwd()). vars parameter possible insert character vector desired variable names load.

title: Load naturalistic data stored in .csv files — nds_load_data
code: ## Considering driver_A.csv, driver_B.csv and driver_C.csv: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") df <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control.

title: Split naturalistic data into the original files — nds_split_data
text: function splits naturalistic data original separation NDS-BR sample. nds_split_data takes naturalistic data imported nds_load_data splits four tibbles, matching original separation drivers provided sample NDS-BR. function uses column containing driver names properly split data.

title: Split naturalistic data into the original files — nds_split_data
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "ndsbr") df <- nds_load_data("driver", path) #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. Use `read_delim()` for more control. #> ℹ Using "','" as decimal and "'.'" as grouping mark. what: ndsbr: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study — ndsbr-package
title: ndsbr: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study — ndsbr-package
text: compilation methods used Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study (NDS-BR). Contains functions load, manipulate analyze naturalistic data.

title: ndsbr: Load, Analyze and Manipulate Data of The Brazilian Naturalistic Driving Study — ndsbr-package
text: Maintainer: Pedro Augusto Borges dos Santos pabsantos21@gmail.com

title: Example NDS-BR Spatial Dataset — ndsbr_data_sf
text: dataset containing trip information NDS-BR research project

title: Example NDS-BR Spatial Dataset — ndsbr_data_sf
Example NDS-BR Spatial Dataset — ndsbr_data_sf
text: data frame sf object 18,012 observations 33 variables: DRIVER chr. identifier driver. DAY chr. date trip. DAY_CORRIGIDO chr. corrected date trip. 03:00:00 chr. timestamp TRIP dbl. trip number. ID chr. trip identifier. PR chr. timestamp GMT-3 timezone H dbl. hour component timestamp. M dbl. minute component timestamp. S dbl. second component timestamp. TIME_ACUM dbl. accumulated time trip seconds. SPD_MPH dbl. speed miles per hour. SPD_KMH dbl. speed kilometers per hour. ACEL_MS2 dbl. acceleration meters per second squared. HEADING dbl. heading direction travel. ALTITUDE_FT dbl. altitude feet. VALID_TIME chr. Indicates whether part trip valid ("Yes" ""). TIMESTAMP_GPS chr. Indicates whether GPS timestamp valid (""). CPOOL chr. Indicates whether trip carpooling ("carpooling"). CPOOLING_CHECKED chr. Indicates whether carpooling checked ("carpooling"). WSB chr. Indicates whether driver using seatbelt ("Yes"). UMP_YN chr. Indicates whether driver using cellphone (""). UMP chr. Indicates whether driver using cellphone ("0"). PICK_UP chr. Indicates pick-cellphone quantity ("0"). ACTION chr. Indicates action taken usage cellphone (NA). GPS_FILE chr. GPS file identifier (NA). CIDADE chr. city name ("Curitiba"). BAIRRO chr. neighborhood name ("JARDIM DAS AMÉRICAS"). NOME_RUA chr. street name ("NPI"). HIERARQUIA_CWB chr. road hierarchy according city Curitiba ("NPI"). HIERARQUIA_CTB chr. road hierarchy according Brazilian Traffic Code ("NPI"). LIMITE_VEL chr. speed limit ("NPI"). geometry POINT. spatial geometry trip location.

title: Example NDS-BR Spatial Dataset — ndsbr_data_sf

title: NDS-BR participants data — ndsdrivers
text: table information drivers participated NDS-BR

title: NDS-BR participants data — ndsdrivers
NDS-BR participants data — ndsdrivers
text: data frame 40 rows 11 variables: driver_id Unique identifier driver, e.g., "", "B", "C". sex Gender driver, e.g., "F" female, "M" male. age Age driver, e.g., 32, 39, 20. license_type Type driver's license, e.g., "B", "AB", "D". vehicle_age Year vehicle's manufacture, e.g., 2012, 2010, 2011. app_driver Indicates driver app driver, e.g., TRUE FALSE. license_date Date driver issued license, e.g., 2009-12-17. vehicle_brand Brand vehicle, e.g., "Chevrolet", "Renault", "VW". vehicle_model Model vehicle, e.g., "Prisma 1.4L LT", "Scenic PRI 1616V". vehicle_hp Horsepower vehicle, extracted strings like "5P/97CV". vehicle_transmission Type vehicle transmission, e.g., "manual", "auto".

text: data frame sf object 27,150 observations 4 variables: osm_id chr. unique identifier road segment OSM. highway chr. type road (e.g., trunk, primary, residential). maxspeed chr. maximum speed limit road segment, km/h. geometry sfc_LINESTRING. spatial geometry road segment.
